result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/ PAC (3rd) .178. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) .178 was dismissed by the court.

  • Laura L. Geboy was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

for ignition interlock exemptions and removing title transfer stops

03:30 PM Defendant Laura L. Geboy in court.  Mary M Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. calling case 15CM229 & 15CM482. Court review of case. Court questions defendant on non-payment.  Review hearing scheduled for August 26, 2019 at 03:00 pm.

03:24 PM Defendant Laura L. Geboy in court.  Calling 15cm229, 15cm482. Defendant provides receipt for payment today. Court notes prior payment was in August; expects more regular payments. Adj. 3:27 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for April 29, 2019 at 03:00 pm.

3:56 p.m. Defendant Laura L. Geboy in court. Defendant provides receipt for almost 1/2 of total due - has paid $600 today. Court notes balance of $660. Adj. 3:59 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for December 10, 2018 at 03:00 pm.
terminated - regular

3:47 p.m. Defendant Laura L. Geboy in court.  Defendant states she will continue making monthly payments. Hopes to make increased payments. Adj. 3:44 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for December 21, 2018 at 03:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Email from Kwik Trip
Community Service hours

1:43 p.m. Defendant Laura L. Geboy in court.  Defendant provides Court with required documentation; Court accepts Habitat for Humanity letter and hours as reflected in letter. Provides copy of email regarding employment. Credit for 17 hours of community service approved by Court. Court expects $100 per month payment beginning on 10/15/17 and each month thereafter. Court expects 2 payments by next review date. Adj. 1:50 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for November 27, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

3:57 p.m. Defendant Laura L. Geboy in court.  Court recites record. Defendant questions whether Court received letter - lost job on June 13th and starts new job this week at Kwik Trip. Could not do community service because she did not have a license and was staying with mother in Eagle River. Court requires letter from George at Habitat for Humanity confirming community service hours and wants document signed by supervisor at Kwik Trip confirming employment as of September 18, 2017 at 4:00 p.m. Court informs defendant to bring toothbrush if does not bring documentation requested. Adj. 4:05 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for September 22, 2017 at 01:15 pm.
from defendant to Judge

3:42 p.m. Defendant Laura L. Geboy in court.  Court recites record. Defendant states she paid $75 today - has been doing community service at Habitat for Humanity. Court stresses need for regular monthly payments. Adj. 3:44 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for September 18, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
Review hearing on June 5, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

TC with Ms Geboy requesting an extension of her review hearing date as she is sick and had not gotten her community service hours organized. Ms Geboy was given a new review date of 6/5/2017 and told this was her LAST extension.

3:06 p.m. Defendant Laura L. Geboy in court.  Defendant states she has performed couple of hours community service. Changed her work hours to evenings so she can do more community service. Made payment online today. Adj. 3:08 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for May 8, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
from Bloom/cancel warrant

from DOC

3:57 p.m. Defendant Laura L. Geboy in court.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court recites record; defendant has been removed from OWI treatment court program. Defendant statement. Court lifts stay on 45 day sentence; defendant to serve balance of 31 days with Huber for all purposes. Defendant remanded immediately. Defendant statement to conversations with ONSO regarding Huber privileges and requests time to report until after paycheck is received. Defendant understands that she is being taken into custody now on probation hold. Defendant states she really needs the week of work and requests time to report until next Friday. Court orders defendant be remanded immediately. Defendant requests 14 days credit for time served - Court denies. Adj. 4:11 p.m.

Defendant Laura L. Geboy in court.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt:
2:38 p.m. Defendant Laura L. Geboy in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Steven Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to dismiss Counts 2, 3, 4 and 5 in 15cm482 - Granted. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters no contest plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Michlig/Voorhees/Defendant /Court statement on sentencing. 
Court Sentence
WHS/POP - 2 years
Jail - 45 days all but 14 days stayed - participation in OWI treatment court - with Huber for all purposes. To commence on/before Friday, April 1, 2016 at 4:00 p.m.
Jail credit - 2 days if revoked
Fine - $1744.00 plus IID/Blood Draw Surcharge
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
Driver's Safety Plan
AODA assessment and follow-through
Driver's license revoked - 24 months
IID - 12 months
DNA Sample 
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Appeal rights given. Payment plan application given. 
Adj. 2:55 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for July 18, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery    - includes cover letter

2:54 p.m. Defendant Laura L. Geboy in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea 
Bail continued. Adj. 2:55 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 23, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
No intoxicants; no taverns. No operation of motor vehicle without valid license and compliance with IID.

2:03 p.m. Defendant Laura L. Geboy in court, via video in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - Michlig statement to bail - Court sets $ cash bond. Intra circuit transfer to Branch 2.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
